page.title: 04A TYPICAL DAY IN SCHOOL
page.content: I live two and a half miles from Builth C.P.School so my parents have to take me to school by car.When I arrive in the playground,I usually play cricket (summer and winter) from about 8.30 to 9.00am when the whistle goes for us to go inside for lessons.First of all,we usually finish off some topic work left over from the day before.Soon,it is time for Assembly and it is sometimes my turn to ring the bell which is kept in our classroom.Assemblies are either taken by various teachers or by a class of children if it is Friday.Back in class,time passes quickly with Englisk or Maths lessons until the bell rings for play-time.Then there is a bit of a mad rush to get hold of cricket bats and the boys's football but we are not supposed to run on the stairs in case of accidents. {(CONTINUED)
